title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without any SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set in the data set editor. 
3. Go to the data source page in the editor. 
4. Change the data source to a new one that has no database, table, or column information. 
5. Observe that the children node listing is not displayed. 
6. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
